elements.title: Amund Dietzel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Amund Dietzel (pictured), sometimes called the "Rembrandt of the rind", learned to tattoo after he went to sea at the age of 14?

elements.title: Regine at the Movies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2001 concert residency Regine at the Movies was restaged seventeen years later?

elements.title: Sylke Haverkorn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that former Dutch rugby union player Sylke Haverkorn served as head coach of the Turkey women's national team before securing the same position at her country's women's national team?

elements.title: CIA shipped color TV sets to Japan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the CIA shipped color TV sets to Japan to broadcast propaganda for the Liberal Democratic Party?

elements.title: Supermodel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Supermodel" is about a fictional character inspired by people Måneskin met in Los Angeles?

elements.title: Green Goblin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the original Green Goblin suit, created by Amalgamated Dynamics for Spider-Man, was scrapped after being deemed "too creepy" by studio executives?

elements.title: Marlene van Staden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that South African mayor Marlene van Staden was re-elected through a coin toss?

elements.title: Hearken to the Witches Rune (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the members of the band that recorded the album Hearken to the Witches Rune do not remember in what year it was released?
